comment: Do not take this class with Prof werner. he is not easy to understand as he doesnt emphasize on his topics. he just shows powerpoints and expects you to assume the rest. He may be a good teacher in other classes but i dont think he should be teaching an intro class.

Werner knows the information needed for the course, but he assumes you do too, so he flies through "lectures" as if he is simply talking to someone in academia like himself. He is arrogant, but one on one, he somewhat tries to help. You will need to know the textbooks front and back, but, luckily, he rarely gives exams. AVOID if possible.

I was a transfer student from China, and am working as Graphic Designer for a company in Atlanta. Dr. Werner is the most inspired teacher I've ever met. He's helpful & always willing to help. We even once talked for 1+ hour after his class around 9pm. He offered me a film shooting project($20/h). BTW I got 2 As in video production & visual thinking

Not an easy A, but an enjoyable class. You have to study or you will not do good. Do the extra credit! He really knows his stuff, but can come across as arrogant at first. He grew on me and became one of my favorite teachers. I would recommend him for sure.

He's incredibly smart, and knows an immense about what he teaches. However, it's impossible to copy notes in his class because he goes through them so quickly, which is annoying due to the fact that all the information is on the exams. I would never recommend taking him because hes not very friendly or helpful to students.

He literally keeps his powerpoint slides for 10-15. He does know and understand what he teaches, but does not stay on the topic very long, nor provide powerpoint to students to look over. This class WILL (I REPEAT WILL) have unbelievable amount of information, so you either stay consistent with the book, or dont take this guy at all
He is a great teacher that really cares about his students.  He is challenging and this is not an "easy A".  The class is worth it because you will learn so much.
He speeds through the lectures. Make sure you really read the book in his class because he is a stickler for infomation.

Werner is incredibly knowledgable when it comes to what he teaches, that's without question. However, he can be extremely vague and his assignments are definitely not for the faint of mind, but you will come out of his class with a better understanding of the subject matter without question. If you need help, ASK QUESTIONS. Highly recommended!

This by far is the hardest art class i've ever taken. Do not take this guy. His lectures were very boring, and you could not follow them because he flipped through the slides extremely fast, not matter how hard you study you will not make an A. His tests are hard as crap. I studied my butt off and pulled a C. Not recommended. Take another elective.
Dr. Werner is an excellent teacher. He may not be all giggles and laughs, but he seems to truly care about his students and what he teaches.
very hard to take notes on his  lectures and slides. hard tests and quizzes. hes a bit stuck up, and annoying. the class made me like art less than before i took the class.

I never thought you could make an art class this hard! I never saw him crack a smile until the 6th week. He puts a lot of what he covers during lecture on the quizzes, but his lectures are difficult to take notes on because he seems so unorganized. I hoped I would find an appreciation for art, but he is making me dislike it even more.

Made art a very tough subject considering the fact that I expected it to be an easy A. Lecture & notes were very unorganized. I think it was his 1st year teaching, so maybe he's gotten better with his teaching methods. There IS extra credit by doing an art project and he's willing to help if you have any questions
